intro: Pilogyne garcinii, commonly known as the African cherry, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The tree produces small, round berries that turn from green to red when ripe, containing a single seed. It is valued for its timber, which is hard and durable, as well as its medicinal properties. The plant also plays an important role in local ecosystems and traditional medicine practices.
